notesStmt.note: Ya῾aḳov ben Mordekhai Pogeṭṭi: inscribed in the colophon, folio 310v.Censored by Boniforte del Asinary: Italian censor (active 1575-1599 in Asti): inscribed with his name: 'Visto et coretto per me Boniforte del Asinari: inscribed (folio 310v).Censored by Hieronimus Carolus: inscribed with his name: 'Fr. Hier. Carolus Asti Die 19 Febr. 1582': inscribed (folio 310v).
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Italian cursive of the 16th century. Shelomoh ben Shemu῾el of Rossina: inscribed in the colophon, folio 310v.

binding.p: Pre-1600. Dark brown leather, blind-tooled, with remains of clasps. Boxed. Spine: 'Sefer Hap-Peliah. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Additional 26,949.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Giuseppe Almanzi (b. 1801, d. 1860), bibliophile; his manuscript no. 58: his library including 322 medieval Hebrew manuscripts were purchased en bloc by the British Museum in October 1865 for £1,000 through Asher & Co., Berlin dealer to the British Museum (see 131-153): inscribed, folio [311v] (fse001v).
